snippet: Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party has stressed the advantages of his bachelorhood in his run for prime minister, but now he has acknowledged an arranged marriage about 45 years ago.
abstract: Narendra Modi of India's Bharatiya Janata Party, who has stressed the advantages of his bachelorhood in his run to become nation's next prime minister, acknowledges his marriage to Jashodaben Chimanlal for the first time on an election registry; family member states Modi left his arranged marriage to Jashodaben 45 years ago because he had chosen a life of service.
lead_paragraph: Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party has stressed the advantages of his bachelorhood in his run for prime minister, but now he has acknowledged an arranged marriage about 45 years ago.

headline.main: Indian Candidate’s Biography Has an Asterisk: A Wife, of Sorts
headline.print_headline: Biography of Candidate Has Asterisk: Wife, of Sorts
